description: A winter island in the New World controlled by the Yonko Kaido. The island is used for weapon manufacturing and is guarded by Scotch, a cyborg subordinate. The island features a snowy climate with giant icicles.

keyEvents.title: X Drake Arrives at Kaido's Winter Island
keyEvents.description: X Drake arrives at this winter island and encounters Scotch, learning it's one of Kaido's favorite islands used for weapon manufacturing.
keyEvents.significance: First reveal of Kaido's weapon manufacturing operations in the New World.

keyEvents.title: Drake Challenges Scotch
keyEvents.description: X Drake deliberately provokes Kaido's subordinate Scotch to gain the Yonko's attention.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Drake's strategic approach to infiltrating Kaido's organization.

statusHistory.reason: Island is operational as a weapon manufacturing base

description: A mysterious island in the New World inhabited by enormous wild boars. The island features invisible pathways in the air that allow people and animals to run through the sky, a bizarre phenomenon unique to the New World.

keyEvents.title: Apoo Battles Giant Boars
keyEvents.description: Scratchmen Apoo and his crew encounter and battle massive wild boars on this island.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the unusual creatures and dangers in the New World.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of Invisible Air Paths
keyEvents.description: While fleeing from giant boars, Apoo and his crew discover they can run on invisible pathways in the air.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals one of the New World's mysterious environmental phenomena.

description: An archipelago near the Red Line, serving as a gateway to the New World. Trafalgar Law and the Heart Pirates are shown near this location.

keyEvents.title: Law Near Sabaody
keyEvents.description: Trafalgar Law and the Heart Pirates discuss their plans near Sabaody Archipelago before entering the New World.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the Supernovas regrouping and preparing for the New World.

description: An island inhabited by giant birds where Tony Tony Chopper was sent by Bartholomew Kuma. The island has a village with a library containing information about medicinal plants.

keyEvents.title: Chopper Returns Early
keyEvents.description: Chopper returns to Birdie Kingdom earlier than expected, attempting to use his 'Chopper Mask' disguise which is immediately seen through.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Chopper's relationship with the island's inhabitants.

keyEvents.title: Chopper Studies at the Library
keyEvents.description: Chopper visits the village library to study medicinal plants and commits to training during the timeskip.
keyEvents.significance: Character development moment showing Chopper's dedication to improvement.
